paper_metadata.title: MAIN TEXT
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: Extracted information on genetic variants in the KCNH2 gene associated with Long QT syndrome, including penetrance data.

functional_data.summary: Mutations in hERG channel that cause LQT2 can reduce the amplitude of IKr by several different mechanisms.

variants.additional_notes: KCNH2 mutations are associated with LQT2 syndrome, characterized by reduced IKr current.
key_quotes: Genetic mutations in both hERG 1a and hERG 1b subunits are associated with LQT2 syndrome.
Diminution in the repolarizing IKr current contributes to lengthening of the QT interval.

extraction_metadata.notes: Only one variant related to KCNH2 was identified, with no specific individual-level data available.
